Class DateTime

  • java.lang.Object
    • DateTime
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DateConstants

    public class DateTime
extends java.lang.Object
implements DateConstants
    A simple data type DateTime to be fleshed out for Project 1 (CSE 1325, Spring 2014)
    Useful for creating DateTime objects (a la DATETIME type supported in Oracle)
    Author:
    skeleton developed by Sharma Chakravarhty, To be completed by the student
    See Also:
    Calendar

    • Constructor Detail

      • DateTime

        public DateTime()
        Constructor: default; returns today's date and time

      • DateTime

        public DateTime(int mo,
        int d,
        int y,
        int h,
        int mi,
        int s,
        int hun)
        Constructor: Does bounds-checking to ensure object represents a valid date and time
        Parameters:
        m - represents the month between 1 and 12
        d - represents the date between 1 and the corresponding number from array DAYS
        y - represents the year
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the date is invalid

      • DateTime

        public DateTime(java.lang.String sDateTime)
        Constructor: Does bounds-checking to ensure string represents a valid date
        Parameters:
        sDate - represents a date given in format mm-dd-yyyy,hh:mm:ss:hund as a string
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the date is invalid

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(DateTime b)
        compares two DateTime objects
        Parameters:
        b - DateTime object
        Returns:
        0 if this DateTime is the same as DateTime b
        negative integer if this DateTime is earlier than DateTime b
        positive integer if this DateTime is after DateTime b
